Description: Glazed composition shallow bowl; upright rim with curved sides and flattened base; mould-made; surface poorly preserved; traces of brown-black paint and greenish blue glaze; framed wavy line around rim, upper interior has two Uzat signs with traces of Nefers between, stylised marsh scene below with lotus blossom and Nile fish; Egyptian or Egyptianising; mended from sherds, missing top of rim.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 193)
Peltenburg 1972 / On the Classification of Faience Vases from Late Bronze Age Cyprus. (Pp. 130-31, Fig. 1)
